dhaka.caption_text:
The Lalbagh Fort was built in the 17th century during the great Mughal period in South Asia. The pink fort used to be the Emperor's residence in the Bengal province, in the heart of Dhaka.

As a Bengali, I love how EF wants to open the world through education, more specifically the exchange of culture and language. I am extremely proud of my ancestor’s fight to preserve the right to speak our mother tongue (which is, according to UNESCO, the sweetest language in the world!).

The Lalbagh Fort was built in the 17th century during the great Mughal period in South Asia. The pink fort used to be the Emperor's residence in the Bengal province, in the heart of Dhaka.

As a Bengali, I love how EF wants to open the world through education, more specifically the exchange of culture and language. I am extremely proud of my ancestor’s fight to preserve the right to speak our mother tongue (which is, according to UNESCO, the sweetest language in the world!).

The Shaheed Minar is a national monument and a tribute to the martyrs killed during the Bengali Language Movement. UNESCO recognises February 21st as 'International Mother Language Day'. The structure represents the 'mother' in the middle with her fallen children.

As a Bengali, I love how EF wants to open the world through education, more specifically the exchange of culture and language. I am extremely proud of my ancestor’s fight to preserve the right to speak our mother tongue (which is, according to UNESCO, the sweetest language in the world!).

jeonju.caption_location: Gyeonggijeon, birthplace of the Joseon Dynasty, Jeonju
jeonju.caption_text:
EF South Korea Ambassador

Gyeonggijeon is the birthplace of the Joseon Dynasty. This is the only place where the portrait of King Taejo who built Joseon is kept.

It is a traditional Korean village in Jeonju, showcasing well-preserved hanok houses, offering a glimpse into Korea's historical architecture and culture.
A unique thing about this place is that people often wear ‘hanbok’ (traditional Korean clothing) while exploring.

I'm currently an EF staff member at the Seoul branch, and I've been here for 3 months.
And, I was an EF student from last year until April of this year. 😊
(Regular semester program for 6 months in New York and Vancouver.)

It is a traditional Korean village in Jeonju, showcasing well-preserved hanok houses, offering a glimpse into Korea's historical architecture and culture.
A unique thing about this place is that people often wear ‘hanbok’ (traditional Korean clothing) while exploring.

I'm currently an EF staff member at the Seoul branch, and I've been here for 3 months.
And, I was an EF student from last year until April of this year. 😊
(Regular semester program for 6 months in New York and Vancouver.)

Jeonju Hanok Village is a cultural and traditional Korean village. Its origin began in the Joseon Dynasty of Korea, and it has been well preserved so far that it has become a good tourist destination. As you see, you can lend korea traditional dress that we called hanbok.

charente.caption_text: EF has been a big part of my life over the past 7 years. Pushing me to pursue my passion of exploring the world and continuously learning about myself and others along the way. During the pandemic, when I had to move to Canada from Denver, Colorado, to be with me now husband during that time, EF's Global presence allowed me to continue working for this amazing company during those tough years, by joining the EF Tours Canada Team instead. The impact that we have on the world and the next generation of global citizens continues to inspire me daily and I am incredibly proud to be part of it.

paris.caption_text: I have been working at EF in the Paris office for 4 years and I love it! I've had some incredible experiences with EF, from a Tour de France finish in Paris to salsa dancing with customers on a boat on Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Every day is a new challenge and I've really learnt that nothing is impossible. I am delighted that my job allows me to share my passion for providing unique and educational experiences to others.
EF makes an impact in my life every day, I get to travel a lot and see new places, meet new amazing costumers, co worker, an supplier, and I learn something new every day!

I am an LGBTQ+ activist, and I feel incredibly proud of EF for supporting initiatives like 'Rugby is my Pride.' Last year, we marched together with Les Coqs Festifs, the gay-friendly rugby club of Paris, and loved experiencing the energy of love, unity, acceptance, and true freedom.

paris.caption_location: Discovering Paris with my colleagues, Paris
paris.caption_text:
I love learning languages with EF! I have studied Spanish at EF Barcelona and English with EF for the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. For this third course I have chosen Paris and it was a wonderful experience to learn French!

I believe EF opens the door for us to become world citizens. It is lovely to be able to read, to understand and to communicate in other languages! Now I can even watch “Emily in Paris” without any subtitles! ❤️
When I stated my EF journey I never thought I would meet such amazing people I can now call friends!
Ich habe eine wunderschöne Zeit bei EF Paris gehabt, die Schule ist sehr schön und zentral gelegen. Mein Französisch hat sich start verbessert und ich habe viele tolle Leute kennengelernt.

lisbon.caption_text:
My EF experience in Malta had a profound impact on both my personal and professional life. Spending four weeks immersed in English, I not only improved my language skills but also gained a deeper understanding of different cultures by connecting with students from all over the world. This international exposure boosted my confidence and broadened my global perspective, which is essential in today’s interconnected world.

Being part of EF also helped me develop valuable soft skills, such as adaptability, communication, and teamwork, as I navigated living in a new environment. These experiences will undoubtedly be beneficial when I pursue the Job Club program in Vancouver in 2025, where I plan to work and live long-term. My time with EF has equipped me with the language skills and global mindset to successfully transition into professional life abroad.

Overall, EF has given me the tools and inspiration to pursue my dream of living and working in Vancouver, making it a crucial stepping stone in my journey toward building an international career.

bournemouth.caption_text:
The EF experience is amazing. I stay in Bournemouth from June 10th to June 28th
I made a general class program

I went to Bournemouth with EF and it was an unforgettable experience EF has great advice before the trip and at destination all the EF staff are always very attentive that you are having an unforgettable experience I also went to a post-tour to Paris and Rome an unforgettable week knowing Europe I thank EF for all the help provided before and on the trip

london.caption_location: 2023 Big Half Marathon in London, London
london.caption_text: Before moving to the London office from the Barcelona office, I thought a half marathon was just for professional athletes or hamsters. But after seeing everyone running or cycling like it was their second job, I figured I'd give it a go—and next thing I knew, I was crossing the finish line at the 2023 Big Half Marathon in London!

british_columbia.caption_text: EF has been a big part of my life over the past 7 years. Pushing me to pursue my passion of exploring the world and continuously learning about myself and others along the way. During the pandemic, when I had to move to Canada from Denver, Colorado, to be with me now husband during that time, EF's Global presence allowed me to continue working for this amazing company during those tough years, by joining the EF Tours Canada Team instead. The impact that we have on the world and the next generation of global citizens continues to inspire me daily and I am incredibly proud to be part of it.

maras.caption_text: I have been working at EF in the Paris office for 4 years and I love it! I've had some incredible experiences with EF, from a Tour de France finish in Paris to salsa dancing with customers on a boat on Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Every day is a new challenge and I've really learnt that nothing is impossible. I am delighted that my job allows me to share my passion for providing unique and educational experiences to others.

I have been working at EF in the Paris office for 4 years and I love it! I've had some incredible experiences with EF, from a Tour de France finish in Paris to salsa dancing with customers on a boat on Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Every day is a new challenge and I've really learnt that nothing is impossible. I am delighted that my job allows me to share my passion for providing unique and educational experiences to others.

massachusetts.caption_text:
My oldest daughter attends EF Academy in Pasadena, CA. We love visiting family in Boston and always running into an EF group enjoying the city.

Being part of the EF family has been amazing. EF Pasadena is an amazing school with well trained and educated faculty. They are exploring how to deliver education in a new and exciting way. We feel blessed to be a part of it.
